sen.j: ハンバーグまたはハンバーグステーキは、挽肉（豚肉や牛肉、またはその他の畜肉等を含めたあわせ挽肉）にタマネギ等の野菜類のみじん切りとコショウ等の香辛料を加え、鶏卵、パン粉を混ぜ、こね合わせたものを楕円形や円形などに整形して焼いた料理。
sen.e: Hanbagu (hamburger) or hanbagu suteki (hamburger steak) is a dish, made by adding minced vegetables such as onions, and seasonings such as pepper into ground meat (pork, beef, other meat of livestock, or a combination of meats), mixing eggs and bread crumbs together, forming the meat mixture into ovals or circles, and broiling them.

Hanbagu (hamburger) or hanbagu suteki (hamburger steak) is a dish, made by adding minced vegetables such as onions, and seasonings such as pepper into ground meat (pork, beef, other meat of livestock, or a combination of meats), mixing eggs and bread crumbs together, forming the meat mixture into ovals or circles, and broiling them.

Hanbagu (hamburger) or hanbagu suteki (hamburger steak) is a dish, made by adding minced vegetables such as onions, and seasonings such as pepper into ground meat (pork, beef, other meat of livestock, or a combination of meats), mixing eggs and bread crumbs together, forming the meat mixture into ovals or circles, and broiling them.

sen.j: 和製英語のひとつであり、英語ではハンバーガー(hamburger)、あるいはソールズベリー・ステーキ(Salisbury steak)と呼ばれる。
sen.e: The 'hanbagu,' one of the waseieigos (Japanese word constructed of elements from one or more English terms), is called 'hamburger' or 'Salisbury steak' in English.
The 'hanbagu,' one of the waseieigos (Japanese word constructed of elements from one or more English terms), is called 'hamburger' or 'Salisbury steak' in English.
The 'hanbagu,' one of the waseieigos (Japanese word constructed of elements from one or more English terms), is called 'hamburger' or 'Salisbury steak' in English.

sen.j: この料理は、下ごしらえに少々手間が掛かるものの、非常に食べ易い状態になっているため、児童や老人等の咀嚼力が弱い人でも食べることができ、また栄養があり消化も良い。
sen.e: This dish, taking a little time for preparations, is a food so easy to chew that even those who have a little masticatory strength, like young children or elderly people, can easily eat it and is also rich in nutrition and easy in digest.

This dish, taking a little time for preparation, is a food so easy to chew that even those who have a little masticatory strength, like young children or elderly people, can easily eat it and is also rich in nutrition and easy to digest.

This dish, taking a little time for preparation, is a food so easy to chew that even those who have a little masticatory strength, like young children or elderly people, can easily eat it and is also rich in nutrition and easy to digest.

sen.j: 大抵は付け合せに温野菜やサラダが用いられ、様々なソース (調味料)類で味付けがされている。
sen.e: In general, it is accompanied with heated vegetables or salad, and seasoned with different kinds of sauces (seasonings).
In general, it is accompanied with heated vegetables or a salad, and seasoned with different kinds of sauces (seasonings).
In general, it is accompanied with heated vegetables or a salad, and seasoned with different kinds of sauces (seasonings).

sen.j: 主に挽肉とみじん切りにした野菜にパン粉を混ぜ、塩を加えて肉の粘性を出し、卵を繋ぎとして焼き固めた物であるが、味の濃いスープで煮込んだ「煮込みハンバーグ」という料理もある。
sen.e: It is the one made by mixing mainly ground meat and minced vegetables with bread crumbs, adding salt, which lends the meat mixture some cohesion, and eggs as a binder, and broiling, and another one is 'nikomi hanbagu (stewed hamburger)' stewed in richly flavored soups.

It is made by mixing mainly ground meat and minced vegetables with bread crumbs, adding salt, which lends the meat mixture some cohesion, and eggs as a binder, and is broiled, and another type is 'nikomi hanbagu (stewed hamburger)' stewed in richly flavored soups.

It is made by mixing mainly ground meat and minced vegetables with bread crumbs, adding salt, which lends the meat mixture some cohesion, and eggs as a binder, and is broiled, and another type is 'nikomi hanbagu' (stewed hamburger) stewed in richly flavored soups.

sen.j: 特に児童に好まれる事もあって給食でも人気メニューであるほか、ファミリーレストランの主力商品でもある。
sen.e: Loved, especially by children, it becomes one of the popular school lunch menus, and a staple item in family restaurants.
Loved, especially by children, it becomes one of the popular items on school lunch menus, and is a staple item in family restaurants.
Loved, especially by children, it becomes one of the popular items on school lunch menus, and is a staple item in family restaurants.

sen.j: ナイフやフォーク (食器)といった食器を使わなくても簡単に噛み千切れるので、パンに挟んでハンバーガーにする事もでき、ファーストフードなどでも主力商品となっている。
sen.e: Since it is tender enough to bite without using any cutlery such as a knife and a fork, 'hanbaga' (a hamburger sandwich) consisting of hamburger patties between two pieces of bread can be made, a feature that ensures a staple item of fast food chains, too.
sen.cmt: （食器）は文中の説明でわかるので訳出しておりません。
sen.e: Since it is tender enough to bite without using any cutlery such as a knife and a fork, 'hanbaga' (a hamburger sandwich) consisting of hamburger patties between two pieces of bread can be made, a feature that ensures a staple item of fast food chains, too.

Since it is tender enough to bite without using any cutlery such as a knife and a fork, 'hanbaga' (a hamburger sandwich) consisting of hamburger patties between two pieces of bread can be made, a feature that ensures a staple item of fast food chains, too.

sen.j: 日本では箸でも容易に切れ、和風の味付けがなされることも多い。
sen.e: It is easily cut into bite-sized pieces even with chopsticks, used in Japan, and often flavored in Japanese style.
It is easily cut into bite-sized pieces even with chopsticks, used in Japan, and often flavored in Japanese style.
It is easily cut into bite-sized pieces even with chopsticks, used in Japan, and often flavored in Japanese style.

sen.j: しかしその反面、ソースの味付け如何では肉の素材自体の品質によってさほど味が左右されないため、長らくは屑肉と呼ばれる商品価値の低い材料を食べられるようにする調理法とされる等の（やや不遇な）扱いを受けていた。
sen.e: On the other hand, since what makes hamburgers delicious depends on sauce seasonings, not quality of ground meat itself, hamburgers have been thought (unjustified a little) to be rather humble creations invented as a means for using up inexpensive ingredients called meat scraps for a long time.

However, since what makes hamburgers delicious depends on sauce seasonings, rather than the quality of the ground meat itself, hamburgers have been thought (unjustified a little) to be rather humble creations invented as a means for using up inexpensive ingredients called meat scraps for a long time.

However, since what makes hamburgers delicious depends on sauce seasonings, rather than the quality of the ground meat itself, hamburgers have been thought (unjustified a little) to be rather humble creations invented as a means for using up inexpensive ingredients called meat scraps for a long time.

sen.j: このため、ハンバーグはしばしば「質や程度の低い料理」と見なされる事がある。
sen.e: For this reason, hamburgers are sometimes regarded as 'a low quality and low sophisticated dish.'
For this reason, hamburgers are sometimes regarded as 'a low quality and low sophisticated dish.'
For this reason, hamburgers are sometimes regarded as 'a low quality and low sophisticated dish.'

sen.j: 元からして、労働者向けの大衆食としての側面も存在している（後述）。
sen.e: Originally, hamburgers have an aspect as a common food for working people (as described later in this article).
Originally, hamburgers had an aspect as a common food for working people (as described later in this article).
Originally, hamburgers had an aspect as a common food for working people (as described later in this article).

sen.j: 様々な工夫を凝らす余地が随所にあるため、非常に多くのバリエーションが存在する。
sen.e: There are various kinds of variations because many different ideas are introduced on the process of cooking.
There are many kinds of variations because many different ideas are introduced in the process of cooking.
There are many kinds of variations because many different ideas are introduced in the process of cooking.

sen.j: 味付けから使用する肉の種類や挽き具合、あるいは混ぜ込む材料や焼き加減などに工夫を凝らすことが可能である。
sen.e: Many ideas can be introduced, such as how to season, what kind of meat to use, how meat to be ground, what kinds of chopped vegetables to be mixed, or how well done hamburger patties should be.
Many ideas can be introduced, like seasoning used, what kind of meat to use, how meat is to be ground, what kinds of chopped vegetables to be mixed in, or how well done hamburger patties should be.
Many ideas can be introduced, like seasoning used, what kind of meat to use, how meat is to be ground, what kinds of chopped vegetables to be mixed in, or how well done hamburger patties should be.

sen.j: 日本においてはハンバーグ専門店などに行かない限り焼き加減は聞かれることは少ないが、欧米諸国では聞かれることが多いと言われている。
sen.e: In Japan, it is rare for diners to be asked how well done their hamburger patties are except in hamburger restaurants, but it is heard that in western countries, diners are often asked how well done.

In Japan, it is rare for diners to be asked how well done they would like their hamburger patties, except in hamburger restaurants, but it is heard that in western countries, diners are often asked if they would like their hamburger steaks rare, medium, or well done.

In Japan, it is rare for diners to be asked how well done they would like their hamburger patties, except in hamburger restaurants, but it is heard that in western countries, diners are often asked if they would like their hamburger steaks rare, medium, or well done.

sen.j: ハンバーグの起源は、ドイツのハンブルクで労働者向けの食事として流行したタルタルステーキを焼き固め、ソースをかけて味付けした料理からだと言われている（「ハンバーグ」は、を英語読みしたもの）。
sen.e: The origin of 'hamburger' is said to derive from a steak tartar broiled and seasoned with sauces, which became popular as a common food for laborers in the German city of Hamburg (the term 'hanbagu' comes from an English pronunciation of 'Hamburg').
sen.cmt: 原文では、（「ハンバーグ」は、Hamburgを英語読みしたもの）Hamburgが抜けていると思われますので、補って訳出しました。
sen.e: The origin of 'hamburger' is said to derive from a steak tartar broiled and seasoned with sauces, which became popular as a common food for laborers in the German city of Hamburg (the term 'hanbagu' comes from an English pronunciation of 'Hamburg').

The origin of 'hamburger' is said to derive from a steak tartar broiled and seasoned with sauces, which became popular as a common food for laborers in the German city of Hamburg (the term 'hanbagu' comes from an English pronunciation of 'Hamburg').

sen.j: なお、タルタルステーキは13世紀頃にヨーロッパにまで攻め込んでいたモンゴル帝国のテュルク系民族タタール人が食べた生肉料理を原型としている。
sen.e: Incidentally, the origin of 'steak tartar' is a raw meat dish which the Turkic Tartar ate, who invaded as far as Europe around the 13th century.
Incidentally, the origin of 'steak tartar' is a raw meat dish which the Turkic Tartar ate, who invaded as far as Europe around the thirteenth century.
Incidentally, the origin of 'steak tartar' is a raw meat dish which the Turkic Tartar of the Mongolian Empire ate, who invaded as far as Europe around the thirteenth century.

sen.j: 大航海時代、船内で備蓄されていた非常に硬い干し肉を乾燥前の状態に負けないくらい柔らかく美味しく調理するために生み出された調理方法（ハンブルグ港を主な寄港先としていた船舶で最も盛んだった）が発祥という説も有る。
sen.e: There is another belief that back to the Age of geographical Discovery, 'hamburger' originally derives from a cooking technique which enabled cooks to make extremely tough dried meat stored in ships as tender and delicious as meat before dried (this technique was most popular for crew in ships which mainly called at the harbor of Hamburg).

There is another belief that back to the Age of geographical Discovery, 'hamburger' originally derived from a cooking technique which enabled cooks to make extremely tough dried meat stored in ships as tender and delicious as meat was before dried (this technique was most popular for crew in ships which mainly called at the harbor of Hamburg).

There is another belief that back to the Age of geographical Discovery, 'hamburger' originally derived from a cooking technique which enabled cooks to make extremely tough dried meat stored in ships as tender and delicious as meat was before dried (this technique was most popular for crew in ships which mainly called at the harbor of Hamburg).

sen.j: アメリカ合衆国では世界大戦中等牛肉のステーキは贅沢なのでハンバーグに変えるという運動もあったという。
sen.e: During the World War, in the United States of America, there used to be a campaign to eat hamburger steak instead of luxurious beef steak.
During World War II, in the United States of America, there used to be a campaign to eat hamburger steak instead of luxurious beef steak.
During World War II, in the United States of America, there used to be a campaign to eat hamburger steak instead of luxurious beef steak.

sen.j: 後にハンバーグパティをバンズではさんだハンバーガーが大人気となり、マクドナルド等ファーストフード店舗の主流となった。
sen.e: Afterward, hamburger buns consisting of hamburger patties placed between two slices of bun became so popular that they were a feature of fast food chains such as McDonald's.
Afterward, hamburgers consisting of hamburger patties placed between two slices of a bun became so popular that they became a feature of fast food chains such as McDonald's.
Afterward, hamburgers consisting of hamburger patties placed between two slices of a bun became so popular that they became a feature of fast food chains such as McDonald's.

sen.j: 1960年代以降の高度経済成長期における日本では、栄養豊富な畜肉が比較的高価な食材であった。
sen.e: From the 1960's onward, during the high economic growth period in Japan, meat of livestock rich in nutrition was one of the relatively expensive ingredients.
From the 1960's onward, during the high economic growth period in Japan, meat of livestock rich in nutrition was one of the relatively expensive ingredients.
From the 1960's onward, during the high economic growth period in Japan, meat of livestock rich in nutrition was one of the relatively expensive ingredients.

sen.j: 安価な挽肉（鶏肉と豚肉等）を使ったこの料理を食卓に上らせる事で、豪華な夕食を演出できるため、同年代以降の主婦が好んで夕食のメニューに取り入れた背景もあって、調理済みで後は焼くだけの物が発売されるなど、瞬く間に日本全国に広まった。
sen.e: Consequently, with housewives, from then on, preferably introducing hamburgers made from cheap ground meat (chicken and pork) on their dinner menu to produce a gorgeous dinner, ready-made hamburgers which only needed broiling appeared on the market, so that hamburgers were available throughout the whole country in a moment.

Consequently, housewives preferably introduced hamburgers made from cheap ground meat (chicken and pork) on their dinner menu to produce a gorgeous dinner, ready-made hamburgers which only needed broiling appeared on the market, so that hamburgers were quickly available throughout the whole country.

Consequently, housewives preferably introduced hamburgers made from cheap ground meat (chicken and pork) on their dinner menu to produce a gorgeous dinner, ready-made hamburgers which only needed broiling appeared on the market, so that hamburgers were quickly available throughout the whole country.

sen.j: 更には1970年代頃から急速に多様化したレトルト食品（レトルト・ハンバーグ）の登場・普及により、非常にありふれた料理となった。
sen.e: Furthermore, since around the 1970's, rapidly diversified retort foods (retort hamburger patties) were put on the market and available, the dish of hamburger became the most common one.
From around the 1970's, rapidly diversified retort foods (retort hamburger patties) were put on the market and were made easily available, hamburger became the most common meal.
From around the 1970's, rapidly diversified retort foods (retort hamburger patties) were put on the market and were made easily available, hamburger became the most common meal.

sen.j: 特にレトルト食品のハンバーグに関しては、調理が簡単である（一度焼いたハンバーグをそのまま、又はソースと共に封入する事で、湯煎するだけで食卓に出す事ができる）事と、少々の材料面における味の不備も漬け込むソース (調味料)でフォローできる事、衛生的な生産工場（セントラルキッチン）による大量生産によって非常に安価に製造できる事により、ファミリーレストランにおいては、主力メニューであると同時に、収益率の高い商品となっていることが多い。
sen.e: In particular, retort hamburger patties often become a breadwinning menu as well as a highly profitable goods in family restaurants due to some merits; quick and easy cooking (hamburger patties can be served on the table just by 'yusen' (warming the containing vessels in hot water) a retort hamburger patty which is once broiled, and enclosed or with a sauce together in a pouch), sauces (seasonings) masking the bland taste of low quality ground meat, and extremely low cost result from mass production in clean factories (central kitchens).

In particular, retort hamburger patties often become a breadwinning menu as well as a highly profitable goods in family restaurants due to some merits; quick and easy cooking (hamburger patties can be served on the table just by 'yusen' (warming the containing vessels in hot water) a retort hamburger patty which is once broiled, and enclosed or with a sauce together in a pouch), sauces (seasonings) masking the bland taste of low quality ground meat, and extremely low cost results from mass production in clean factories (central kitchens).

In particular, retort hamburger patties often become a breadwinning menu as well as a highly profitable goods in family restaurants due to some merits; quick and easy cooking (hamburger patties can be served on the table just by 'yusen' (warming the containing vessels in hot water) a retort hamburger patty which is once broiled, and enclosed or with a sauce together in a pouch), sauces (seasonings) masking the bland taste of low quality ground meat, and extremely low cost results from mass production in clean factories (central kitchens).

sen.j: なおレストランによっては、レトルト食品のハンバーグでは焼いた際のふっくら感が出し難いために、焼く前の生のハンバーグを冷凍又は冷蔵してストックしておき、それを解凍して焼き上げるところもある。
sen.e: Some restaurants, however, thaw raw hamburger patties in frozen or chilled storage and then broil them in order to serve light and fluffy textured hamburger patties, a texture which retort hamburger patties cannot provide when broiled.

Some restaurants, however, thaw raw hamburger patties in frozen or chilled storage and then broil them in order to serve light and fluffy textured hamburger patties, a texture which retort hamburger patties cannot provide when broiled.

Some restaurants, however, thaw raw hamburger patties in frozen or chilled storage and then broil them in order to serve light and fluffy textured hamburger patties, a texture which retort hamburger patties cannot provide when broiled.

sen.j: 今日のハンバーガーチェーン店では、この冷凍ハンバーグが広く使われている。
sen.e: These frozen hamburger patties are widely used in present-day hamburger chain restaurants.
These frozen hamburger patties are widely used in present-day hamburger chain restaurants.
These frozen hamburger patties are widely used in present-day hamburger chain restaurants.

sen.j: ハンバーグの素材として一般的な豚肉や牛肉以外に、他の食材を使う場合も有る。
sen.e: Pork and beef meat, common ingredients, are used for hamburgers, but other ingredients are sometimes used.
Pork and beef meat, common ingredients, are used for hamburgers, but other ingredients are sometimes used.
Pork and beef meat, common ingredients, are used for hamburgers, but other ingredients are sometimes used.

sen.j: 例えば鶏肉を使う等である。
sen.e: For example, chicken meat is used.
For example, chicken meat is used.
For example, chicken meat is used.

sen.j: さらに、肉類を使わない、魚肉系の肉を使う物、豆腐を使った豆腐ハンバーグなどもみられる。
sen.e: Furthermore, hamburgers can also be made by mixing meat substitutes such as fish meat or tofu, which can be seen as tofu hamburgers.
Furthermore, hamburgers can also be made by mixing meat substitutes such as fish meat or tofu, which can be seen as tofu hamburgers.

sen.j: 刻んで入れられる野菜に関してはタマネギが最も多く用いられるが、ニンジンが入る事もあり、こちらはニンジンが苦手な児童でも喜んで食べる事ができるというもので、他にもグリーンピースなど児童が苦手とする野菜類の入ったものもある。
sen.e: As for chopped vegetables mixed with ground meat, onions are most commonly used or chopped carrots or green peas are sometimes mixed for children, picky eaters, who are willing to eat such their unfavorite vegetables hiding in hamburgers.

As for chopped vegetables mixed with ground meat, onions are most commonly used or chopped carrots or green peas are sometimes mixed for children, picky eaters are willing to eat unpopular vegetables hidden in hamburgers.

sen.j: またシイタケを少量刻んで入れることで風味が増すことが知られている他、半分に切って種を取り除いたピーマンに、焼く前のハンバーグの材料を詰め込み、肉詰めピーマンが作られる。
sen.e: Besides, it is known that adding a small amount of chopped shiitake mushrooms makes hamburgers more flavorful and stuffed pimentos are made by halving a pimento, removing the seeds, and stuffing a raw hamburger meat mixture inside the pimento.

sen.j: チーズをハンバーグの上に乗せたり中に詰めたものは、チーズバーグまたはチーズハンバーグと言うことも有る。
sen.e: Hamburgers with a slice of cheese placed on the top, or stuffed inside them are sometimes called 'cheese burger' or 'cheese hamburger'
Hamburgers with a slice of cheese placed on the top, or stuffed inside them are sometimes called 'cheese burgers' or 'cheese hamburgers.'
Hamburgers with a slice of cheese placed on the top, or stuffed inside them are sometimes called 'cheese burgers' or 'cheese hamburgers.'

sen.j: 付け合せとしてはその他に目玉焼きが載せられることもある。
sen.e: In addition, a sunny-side up is sometimes placed on the top as a relish.
In addition, an egg, sunny-side up is sometimes placed on the top.
In addition, an egg, sunny-side up is sometimes placed on the top.

sen.j: ハンバーグを別の料理に取り込む事で、その料理をより豪華にする事も可能である。
sen.e: Adding a hamburger patty to other dishes can also make the dishes more gorgeous.

sen.j: ハンバーグカレーはその最たる物である。
sen.e: Hamburger curry is that prime example.
Hamburger curry is a prime example.
Hamburger curry is a prime example.

sen.j: また、ファミリーレストランなどでは彩りと栄養を考えて数種の野菜を添えることが多く、ニンジンのグラッセ（甘煮）、フライドポテト、インゲンの炒め物やパセリといった赤・黄・緑の三色の組み合わせがポピュラーである。
sen.e: In family restaurants, taking a balance of colors and nutrition into account, they serve hamburgers with several kinds of vegetables such as glazed carrots (boiled sweet), fried potatoes, sautéed green beans, and paisley, arranging a popular assortment of red, yellow, and green colored vegetables.

In family restaurants, taking the balance of colors and nutrition into account, they serve hamburgers with several kinds of vegetables such as glazed carrots (boiled sweet), fried potatoes, sautéed green beans, and paisley, arranging a popular assortment of red, yellow, and green colored vegetables.

sen.j: 手軽さを考えてミックスベジタブル（ニンジン、トウモロコシ、グリーンピースの混合）で三色を揃える例も見られる。
sen.e: An example is seen that mixed vegetables (mixture of carrot dices, corn, and green peas) are used for easily preparing the three colors.
An example is seen where mixed vegetables (mixture of diced carrots, corn, and green peas) are used for easily preparing the three colors.

sen.j: そのほかにも、トマトベースのソース仕立ての「イタリアンハンバーグ」、ダイコンおろしと和風ベースのソース仕立ての「（和風）おろしハンバーグ」、デミグラスソースベースで煮込んだ「煮込みハンバーグ」などがある。
sen.e: Other variations include 'Italian hamburger' with tomato based sauce, 'hamburger with grated radish (in Japanese style)' with grated radish and a sauce of Japanese taste, and 'stewed hamburger' with demi-glace sauce (type of brown sauce).

Another variation is the 'Italian hamburger' with a tomato based sauce, 'hamburger with grated radish (in Japanese style)' with grated radish and a sauce of Japanese taste, and 'stewed hamburger' with demi-glace sauce (type of brown sauce).

Another variation is the 'Italian hamburger' with a tomato based sauce, 'hamburger with grated radish (in Japanese style)' with grated radish and a sauce of Japanese taste, and 'stewed hamburger' with demi-glace sauce (type of brown sauce).

sen.j: 同様の材料を大きな塊のままオーブンで焼き上げたものはミートローフ、一口で食べられる大きさにしたものはミートボールと呼ぶ。
sen.e: A large lump of hamburger meat mixture of the same kind baked in an oven is referred to as 'meat loaf,' and formed into bite-sized balls as meatballs.
A large lump of hamburger meat mixture of the same kind baked in an oven is referred to as a 'meat loaf,' and formed into bite-sized balls as meatballs.
A large lump of hamburger meat mixture of the same kind baked in an oven is referred to as a 'meat loaf,' and formed into bite-sized balls as meatballs.

sen.j: ハンバーグに衣をつけて揚げたものはメンチカツと呼ばれる。
sen.e: Raw hamburger patties breaded and deep fried in oil is called as 'menchikatsu.'
Raw hamburger patties breaded and deep fried in oil is called as 'menchikatsu.'
Raw hamburger patties breaded and deep fried in oil is called as 'menchikatsu.'

sen.j: ロールキャベツの中身もほぼ同じである。
sen.e: The stuff of 'rorukyabetsu' (stuffed cabbage) is almost the same meat mixture.
The stuffing used for 'rorukyabetsu' (stuffed cabbage) is almost the same meat mixture.
The stuffing used for 'rorukyabetsu' (stuffed cabbage) is almost the same meat mixture.

sen.j: 日本では、食糧の保存加工技術が進歩した縄文時代中期のものと思われる、堅果などのデンプン質が残留した、ビスケットないしはパン状の「縄文クッキー」（パン（クッキー）状炭化物）と呼ばれる、炭化物の考古遺物が出土する。
sen.e: In Japan, carbonized archaeological relics, called 'Jomon cookies' (carbonized bread like (cookie like) materials) are excavated, which contain residues of the nut's starch and are thought to be the relics from the middle of Jomon period, when the technique for preserving and processing food had progressed.

In Japan, carbonized archaeological relics, called 'Jomon cookies' (carbonized bread like (cookie like) materials) were excavated, that contain residues of the nut's starch and are thought to be relics from the middle of the Jomon period, when the technique for preserving and processing food had progressed.

In Japan, carbonized archaeological relics, called 'Jomon cookies' (carbonized bread like (cookie like) materials) were excavated, that contain residues of the nut's starch and are thought to be relics from the middle of the Jomon period, when the technique for preserving and processing food had progressed.

sen.j: 炭化物の分析からは、植物質材料のほかに獣肉や血液および野鳥の卵が含まれる可能性が指摘され、現代のハンバーグに通じる食品が想定された。
sen.e: The analysis of the carbonized materials indicates that they might include some animal meat and blood, eggs of wild birds as well as plants' materials and they are thought to be a food associated with present-day hamburger patties.

The analysis of the carbonized materials indicates that they might include some animal meat and blood, eggs of wild birds as well as plant materials and they are thought to be a food associated with present-day hamburger patties.

The analysis of the carbonized materials indicates that they might include some animal meat and blood, eggs of wild birds as well as plant materials and they are thought to be a food associated with present-day hamburger patties.

sen.j: 分析に用いられた残留脂肪酸分析法は現在では信頼性が疑問視されているため、確実性には乏しいものの、縄文時代にはイノシシやシカが主要な狩猟対象となっていることから、可能性はあると考えられている。
sen.e: At present, questioning and lacking the credibility of the analysis of residual fatty acid used for analyzing the carbonized materials, there still exists the possibility that the 'Jomon cookie' was a kind of hamburger because wild bores and deer were major targets for hunting during the Jomon period.

At present, questioning and lacking the credibility of the analysis of residual fatty acid used for analyzing the carbonized materials, there still exists the possibility that the 'Jomon cookie' was a kind of hamburger because wild bores and deer were major targets for hunting during the Jomon period.

At present, questioning and lacking the credibility of the analysis of residual fatty acid used for analyzing the carbonized materials, there still exists the possibility that the 'Jomon cookie' was a kind of hamburger because wild bores and deer were major targets for hunting during the Jomon period.

sen.j: また、焼かずに乾燥させたペミカンのような保存食であったとする説もある。
sen.e: Another says that the 'Jomon cookie' might be a preservative food like pemmican, which was dried not broiled.
Another says that the 'Jomon cookie' might be a type of preservative food like pemmican, which was dried and not broiled.
Another says that the 'Jomon cookie' might be a type of preservative food like pemmican, which was dried and not broiled.

tit.j: 家庭で作るハンバーグ

sen.j: 家庭でハンバーグを作る際、幾つかの点で工夫すると、更に味が引き立つ。
sen.e: In making hamburgers at home, several helpful hints make them tastier
In making hamburgers at home, several helpful hints make them tastier
In making hamburgers at home, several helpful hints make them tastier.

sen.j: 肉は牛や豚を単独で用いるよりも、合挽き肉の方が両方の長所が引き立って良いとされる。
sen.e: It is said that it is better to use mixture of ground beef and pork, making a good complement to each other, than only ground beef or pork.
It is said that it is better to use mixture of ground beef and pork, as they complement each other, than just using ground beef or pork.
It is said that it is better to use mixture of ground beef and pork, as they complement each other, than just using ground beef or pork.

sen.j: 日本では牛肉料理に脂身の繊細にのった霜降りが好まれるが、ハンバーグの場合には脂身が少ないほうが肉の風味が濃く味わえるため適しており、加えて赤身肉は日本では安価な傾向が強いことも家庭料理に向いている理由となっている。
sen.e: In Japan, well marbled beef is preferable for meat dishes, but in the case of hamburgers, lean meat with low fat is more suitable to taste the meat flavor itself and also cheaper, thus being appropriate for home made cooking.

In Japan, well marbled beef is preferable for meat dishes, but in the case of hamburgers, lean meat with low fat is more suitable to taste the meat flavor itself and is also cheaper, thus being appropriate for home made cooking.

In Japan, well marbled beef is preferable for meat dishes, but in the case of hamburgers, lean meat with low fat is more suitable to taste the meat flavor itself and is also cheaper, thus being appropriate for home made cooking.

sen.j: また、多少手間がかかるものの、みじん切りにしたタマネギを先に炒めてから生地に加えることでより甘みが増す。
sen.e: Although it takes a little time for preparations, adding chopped onions previously sautéed into ground meat increases natural sweetness of hamburgers.
Although it takes little time to preparare, adding chopped onions previously sautéed into ground meat increases the natural sweetness of hamburgers.
Although it takes little time to preparer, adding chopped onions previously sautéed into ground meat increases the natural sweetness of hamburgers.

sen.j: 繋ぎのパン粉は、市販のものをそのまま使うよりも、細かくちぎった食パンを牛乳等でふやかしたものを用いる方が食感が増し、加えて味がまろやかになる。
sen.e: What can be said about bread crumbs as a binder is that using bread crumbled into small pieces and soaked in milk makes hamburgers smoother in texture and milder in taste than using bread crumbs commercially available.

What can be said about bread crumbs as a binder is that using bread crumbled into small pieces and soaked in milk makes hamburgers smoother in texture and milder in taste than using bread crumbs commercially available.

What can be said about bread crumbs as a binder is that using bread crumbled into small pieces and soaked in milk makes hamburgers smoother in texture and milder in taste than using bread crumbs commercially available.

sen.j: ただし充分に小さくちぎらないとかえって食感を損ねる。
sen.e: Bread broken into rough pieces, however, provides tough texture.
Bread broken into rough pieces, however, provides a tough texture.
Bread broken into rough pieces, however, provides a tough texture.

sen.j: また耳の部分を用いても食感を損ねる。
sen.e: Using bread crust gives rough texture, too.
Using bread crust gives a rough texture, too.
Using bread crust gives a rough texture, too.

sen.j: なお、日本放送協会のためしてガッテンでは2009年4月22日の放送でパン粉の代用として麩と寒天を使用する方法を紹介している()。
sen.e: Broadcasted on April 22, 2009, a TV program, 'Tameshite Gatten (Experience and Understand),' of Japan Broadcasting Corporation introduces the way to use 'fu' (bread like pieces of wheat gluten) and 'kanten' (Japan agar) instead of using bread crumbs.
sen.cmt: 文末の（）は訳出しておりません。
sen.e: Broadcasted on April 22, 2009, a TV program, 'Tameshite Gatten (Experience and Understand),' of Japan Broadcasting Corporation introduces the way to use 'fu' (bread like pieces of wheat gluten) and 'kanten' (Japan agar) instead of using bread crumbs.

Broadcasted on April 22, 2009, a TV program, 'Tameshite Gatten' (Experience and Understand), of Japan Broadcasting Corporation introduces the way to use 'fu' (bread like pieces of wheat gluten) and 'kanten' (Japan agar) instead of using bread crumbs.

sen.j: 大きなハンバーグを作る際、なかなか中心まで火が通らず、ひっくり返そうとして崩れてしまう事が有る。
sen.e: With large hamburger patties fried in a pan, which is cooked unevenly, they sometimes split away when turned over in order to cook to well done.
With large hamburger patties fried in a pan, cooked unevenly, they sometimes split away when turned over in order to cook well done.
With large hamburger patties fried in a pan, cooked unevenly, they sometimes split away when turned over in order to cook well done.

sen.j: この場合、焼く前に皿に置いてラップを掛け、電子レンジで肉汁が滲み出すまで加熱して焼くと、厚みのあるものも綺麗に焼け、中まで良く火がとおる。
sen.e: In this case, even the thick hamburger patties are cooked well done and beautifully by putting the patties on a plate, covering the plate with plastic wrap, heating it in a microwave oven till the patties begin to exude meat juice, before frying them in a pan.

In this case, even the thick hamburger patties can be cooked well done and beautifully by putting the patties on a plate, covering the plate with plastic wrap, heating it in a microwave oven till the patties begin to exude juice, before frying them in a pan.

In this case, even the thick hamburger patties can be cooked well done and beautifully by putting the patties on a plate, covering the plate with plastic wrap, heating it in a microwave oven till the patties begin to exude juice, before frying them in a pan.

sen.j: 電子レンジ加熱中に出た肉汁は肉の旨みを含んでいるので、ソースに利用する。
sen.e: Since the gravy wept from the patties while they are heated in a microwave oven includes delicious taste, it is used for making a sauce.
Since gravy from the patties heated in a microwave oven has a delicious taste, it is used for making sauce.
Since gravy from the patties heated in a microwave oven has a delicious taste, it is used for making sauce.

sen.j: 他にも、フライパンで焼き目をつけた後、予熱したオーブンで中まで焼き上げるという手法も用いられる。
sen.e: In addition, a recipe of frying hamburger patties in a pan till well browned on the bottom before baking them in a preheated oven is also followed.
In addition, a recipe for frying hamburger patties in a pan till well browned on the bottom before baking them in a preheated oven is also followed.
In addition, a recipe for frying hamburger patties in a pan till well browned on the bottom before baking them in a preheated oven is also followed.

sen.j: O157等の食中毒を予防するためには、厚みを減らし中心部を充分加熱する（75℃で1分等）べきであるとされる。
sen.e: Reducing the thickness of hamburger patties and heating the internal patties (75℃ for one minute) prevents food poisoning such as a contamination of Escherichia coli 0157:H7.
Reducing the thickness of hamburger patties and heating the inside of the patties (75℃ for one minute) prevents food poisoning such as a contamination from Escherichia coli 0157:H7.
Reducing the thickness of hamburger patties and heating the inside of the patties (75℃ for one minute) prevents food poisoning such as a contamination from Escherichia coli 0157:H7.

sen.j: 温度を測る目安としては、金串を刺してしばらく待って素早く引き抜き、先端部を唇に当て熱いと感じる程度がよいとされるが、温度を測りやすく計測部がステンレス鋼製チューブとなっていて、衛生的に利用できる料理用の電子温度計も販売されている。
sen.e: A steel skewer is used for judging a temperature of internal hamburger patties by inserting it in a hamburger patty, leaving it in for a while, pulling it out and quickly placing the tip of it on the lips, a temperature should feel hot, and an electric thermometer for cooking is commercially available, whose measuring part is made of stainless steel tube, easy to measure temperatures and sanitary to use.

A steel skewer is used to judge the inside temperature of the hamburger patties by inserting it and leaving it in for a while, pulling it out and quickly placing the tip of it on the lips, the temperature should feel hot, and an electric thermometer for cooking is commercially available, with a gauge made of stainless steel, with this it is easy to measure temperatures and is sanitary to use.

A steel skewer is used to judge the inside temperature of the hamburger patties by inserting it and leaving it in for a while, pulling it out and quickly placing the tip of it on the lips, the temperature should feel hot, and an electric thermometer for cooking is commercially available, with a gauge made of stainless steel, with this it is easy to measure temperatures and is sanitary to use.
